snippet: Fans at the U.S. Open paid tribute to Payne Stewart, the 1999 winner, who died in a plane crash four months after his victory, and they also heaped their love onto Phil Mickelson.
abstract: Karen Crouse On Golf column; fans at the US Open pay tribute to Payne Stewart, 1999 winner who died in a plane crash four months after his victory; also shower Phil Mickelson with support as he chases elusive Open victory amid entanglement in insider trading investigation.
lead_paragraph: Fans at the U.S. Open paid tribute to Payne Stewart, the 1999 winner, who died in a plane crash four months after his victory, and they also heaped their love onto Phil Mickelson.

headline.main: Stewart Tributes Fill Day 1 of U.S. Open as Mickelson Feels the Crowd’s Support
headline.print_headline: Stewart Tributes Fill Day 1 as Mickelson Feels the Crowd’s Support
